header: The Division of the Land of Canaan

verse: The following are the allotted inheritances for the descendants of Israel in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leading fathers of the tribes allotted as an inheritance to the people of Israel.
The inheritances for nine tribes and the half tribe of Manasseh were determined by lot, just as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
Moses had already assigned inheritances to two tribes and to one half tribe in the region east of the Jordan, but to the Levites he did not give an inheritance among the other tribes.

Because the sons of Joseph had been divided into two tribes, namely, Manasseh and Ephraim, the Levites did not receive a tribal territory in the land. They did, however, receive cities to live in along with the cities’ pasturelands for their cattle and property.
Just as the Lord had commanded Moses, that is what the people of Israel did when they apportioned the land.
When the people of Judah came to Joshua at Gilgal, Caleb son of Jephunneh, the Kenizzite, said this to him:
So Joshua blessed him, and he gave Hebron to Caleb son of Jephunneh as an inheritance.
Therefore Hebron has belonged to Caleb son of Jephunneh, the Kenizzite, as an inheritance to this day, because he fully followed after the Lord, the God of Israel.
The name of Hebron formerly was Kiriath Arba. Arba was the greatest man among the Anakites.
